PROFILE

A highly skilled process engineer with deep experience in manufacturing environments. Possessing a diverse background across various industries such as oil and gas, plastics, lubricants, and steelmaking. Further experience with programming, automation, and full-stack development. Motivated and detail-oriented, capable of excelling in both team-based and independent work environments
Driven to utilize strong technical skills and commitment to sustainability to drive innovation and create a positive impact on the environment and society while bringing value to the organization
 

TECHNICAL SKILLS

•	Experience in both upstream oil sands and downstream refining operations, focusing on distillation, sour water treatment, and fluid catalytic / delayed coking technologies
•	Significant experience in delivering technical support for day-to-day operations, short-term optimization initiatives, as well as unit turnarounds and long-term projects to improve yield and throughput
•	Thorough knowledge of P&IDs, equipment degradation mechanisms, sizing pressure relief devices, restriction orifices, and working with process control and instrumentation datasheets
•	Strong understanding of regulatory requirements (API, ASME, OSHA), design practices and safe operating principles (HAZOPs, SRRs, PHAs); experienced in use of design and modeling software (PRO/II, Aspen HYSYS, Pegasys#, etc)
•	Analytically minded, knowledgeable in using data analysis software (JMP, MATLAB, PI ProcessBook, ROMeo)
•	Excellent problem solving and communication skills both within technical groups and business environments; able to work efficiently in an independent or team environment
•	Expertise in transforming technical data into practical reports/presentations using MS Word, Excel, PowerPoint, and Visio; strong knowledge of HTML, CSS, JavaScript, Node.js, React, MongoDB, PostgreSQL
 

EDUCATION

Bachelor of Science, Chemical Engineering (Honours), University of Waterloo, Waterloo, ON	April 2013
•	Option in Management Sciences
 

PROFESSIONAL EXPERIENCE

Independent Consultant, Toronto, ON	December 2021 - Present
Full-stack Web Developer
•	Collaborated with a team of developers to build modern and responsive web applications, leveraging HTML/CSS/JavaScript for front-end and Node.js/React.js for back-end development 
•	Built semantically structured full stack web applications and deployed on AWS and Azure hosting services
•	Applied SCRUM agile methodology for project management to streamline development and ensure robust communications with customers
•	Utilized relational (MySQL) and non-relational databases (MongoDB) based on client needs; utilized GitHub for version control and branch logic

 
ExxonMobil, Baton Rouge, LA	December 2017 - June 2020
Delayed Coker Technical Lead
•	Provided technical leadership for operation of a 110 KBPD delayed coking complex, serving as interface between technical organization and greater business leadership team
•	Delivered daily guidance and mentorship of junior process engineers; effective process monitoring avoided $2.0M/year in losses and a further $600k increase in liquid yield through optimization initiatives
•	Sustained identification and advancement of long-term improvement opportunities; technical lead for various large capital projects ($100M+) such as slide-valve implementation for coke drums
•	Served as technical lead for West Coker planned turnaround; timely inspections and thorough repair reports led to process technical work scope completing 2 days ahead of schedule
 

Syncrude Canada, Fort McMurray, AB	October 2013 - December 2017
Process Contact Engineer 
•	Directed routine unit monitoring for conversion units (distillation/vacuum tower, fluid coker) to identify short-term and long-term unit issues preventing liquid yield losses of $1.5M/year
•	Led unit alarm rationalization for all tags in unit's alarm database; leveraged disciplines to set parameters based on process trends, equipment strategies, and operator knowledge, reducing nuisance alarms and bad actor alarms by over 80%
•	Provided technical support for mechanical outages for conversion units by inspecting vessels and delivering recommendations on required repairs; avoided delays to critical path work preventing losses of $400k/day
•	Engaged with external vendors and Syncrude R&D on improvement projects to extend unit run length by 20% and, to increase liquid yield by 0.4% resulting in annual value creation of $12M
 

NOVA Chemicals, Mississauga, ON	May 2012 – August 2012
Process Design Intern
•	Validated 80+ pressure relief devices including pressure safety valves, rupture disks, and tank vents to ensure operational safety of pumps, compressors, and heat exchangers
•	Developed a procedure to size pressure relief devices for supercritical fluid overpressure scenarios, enabling sizing of 20+ pressure relief devices in supercritical service
•	Analyzed piping for high pressure equipment using PipeFlow software and proposed over 10 solutions for reducing inlet pressure losses to relief devices and centrifugal pumps
•	Established regular communication with operators to gather plant data to create missing isometrics and rectify outdated process and instrumentation diagrams, creating 100+ isometric drawings


Now the job description:

Are you an experienced sales engineer looking for your next challenge? Are you looking to apply your technical and sales skills in a new arena? If so, read on!

Kickr Design is looking for an experienced off-site Business Development Engineer that is interested in joining a growing company in a fast-paced environment. The ideal candidate has a passion for engineering, advanced product design (Medical Devices, high technology, industrial automation), is excellent at developing strong relationships with prospects, and can demonstrate an ability to quickly and creatively solve problems. The position also requires an individual that works well on their own, interacts with clients with professionalism, and is confident in his/her own sales and business development skills.

We are looking for a candidate with a very strong engineering background, who has been on the leading edge of business development or sales engineering in a highly technical field. The ideal candidate will have worked in multiple industries as an engineer and have a strong breadth of knowledge in mechanical and electrical systems as well as excellent communication skills and a passion for closing those elusive customers!

As a Business Development Engineer, you will own the outside business development arena and drive our company's growth by winning new deals for our talented, diverse engineering team. You will seek out and court prospects ranging from startups to large brands and businesses, each with their own completely unique products and engineering challenges. You will leverage Kickr Designs extensive engineering capability in your discussions, finding interesting problems that our engineering team can help solve across multiple industries, engineering disciplines and project types.

Key Tasks:

Prospect customers, arrange meetings and on-site visits

Attend events locally in Atlanta, GA, the Southeast and select events around the country on behalf of Kickr Design

Network and meet potential customers while fostering relationships with prospects.

You will setup project consultations with a wide range of unique companies over the phone or in-person

Speak directly with clients and provide helpful engineering insights in conversation

Draft & send personalized proposals/estimates for new projects

Attend project "Kick-Off" meetings & hand off project to engineering team

Work with the Sales Engineering team to close jobs

Requirements

Minimum Bachelors degree in Engineering (any discipline)

Well-rounded engineering knowledge

Ability to discuss and brainstorm a wide variety of solutions to a hugely diverse set of potential problems

5 years customer facing experience in Sales, Sales Engineering or Business Development

Excellent interpersonal skills are a MUST!

Excellent oral and written communication skills are a MUST!

Benefits

Strong base salary with Sales Commission (uncapped)

Excellent health insurance including dental and vision at no cost to you, including subsidized premiums for dependents

Massive variety in day-to-day work and project types, always interesting

How would you go about debugging a Docker container?

Give me a short answer

To debug a Docker container, first, identify the container by running `docker ps`. Then, use `docker logs <container_id>` to view logs and identify potential issues. If needed, access the container's shell with `docker exec -it <container_id> /bin/bash` (or `/bin/sh`) to explore further or interactively debug the application within the container.
What are API 650 and API 620 used for? Provide details

API 650 and API 620 are two widely accepted design standards for the construction of storage tanks, established by the American Petroleum Institute (API).

1. API 650: This standard covers the design, fabrication, and erection of aboveground, vertical, cylindrical, closed- and open-top welded storage tanks for internal pressures approximating atmospheric pressure (up to a maximum of 2.5 psi). It is predominantly used for designing storage tanks that store oil, petroleum, water, and chemicals at ambient temperature. API 650 specifies requirements for materials, design, fabrication, and testing of tanks, primarily focusing on maintaining the structural integrity and safety of tanks under atmospheric pressure conditions. It addresses roof design, shell and bottom plate design, foundation design, and other requirements to ensure tank stability and longevity.

2. API 620: This standard governs the design and construction of large, welded, low-pressure carbon steel above-ground storage tanks, including flat-bottom tanks designed for storage of lower-viscosity liquids that may require higher internal pressures (up to 15 psi) or have lower temperature limits (-325 to +250 degrees Fahrenheit). API 620 is typically used for tanks storing cryogenic liquids such as liquified gases, as well as certain chemicals and high-vapor pressure substances. Similar to API 650, it provides guidelines on materials, design, construction, inspection, and testing to ensure these tanks withstand higher internal pressures and keep their contents securely stored.

Both standards aim to ensure proper and safe storage of various substances and are utilized in industries such as oil and gas, refining, petrochemical, and chemical storage. These standards are maintained and periodically updated to reflect current best practices for design, fabrication, and construction in the industry.
What is the typical project workflow in an EPC? Describe in detail

An EPC (Engineering, Procurement, and Construction) project is a contracting approach where a single contractor is responsible for completing design, procurement, and construction activities for an infrastructure project. This approach streamlines project management and reduces overall project risks. The typical project workflow in an EPC can be divided into several stages, as detailed below:

1. Initial Consultation and Pre-Engineering Phase: EPC contractors meet with project owners and stakeholders to understand project objectives, goals, constraints, and requirements. Feasibility studies, site assessments, preliminary cost estimations, and scheduling are performed to outline project scope, budget, and timeline.

2. Conceptual Design and Basic Engineering: Based on the pre-engineering findings, EPC contractors develop a conceptual design, specifying the layout, process flow, and systems required for the project. This phase may also involve acquiring necessary permits, regulatory approvals, and environmental clearances.

3. Detailed Engineering and Design: EPC teams refine the conceptual design into a comprehensive engineering package, including detailed mechanical, electrical, structural, instrumentation, and control system designs. These designs are validated through computer simulations, modeling, and other analysis to ensure the project meets all technical specifications, safety regulations, and functional requirements.

4. Procurement: EPC contractors procure all required equipment, materials, and services, including subcontractors, suppliers, and labor. Procurement activities often include negotiations, contracts, logistics, transportation, and quality control of purchased items.

5. Construction: EPC contractors oversee the entire construction process, including site preparation, civil works, equipment and system installation, infrastructure development, and utility integration. They monitor construction progress, ensure quality and safety, and manage any on-site changes or contract modifications.

6. Commissioning, Testing, and Startup: After construction, EPC teams perform system testing, quality checks, and commissioning activities to ensure the facility operates as designed. This phase includes calibration, functional testing, performance testing, and collaboration with operational teams.

7. Project Handover and Closeout: Upon successful commissioning, the EPC contractor hands over the project to the owner, including all necessary documentation, operating manuals, warranties, spare parts inventory, and training of personnel. A final project report is generated, and a project closeout process includes addressing any outstanding issues, outstanding payments, or dispute resolution.

Throughout the EPC project workflow, communication, and coordination between the EPC contractor, project owner, and other stakeholders is critical to ensuring that the project runs smoothly, stays within budget, and is completed on schedule. Risk management and mitigation also play an integral role in each stage of the project workflow.
What are some strategic ways of thinking vs task oriented ways of thinking? Clarify the distinction with some examples

Strategic thinking and task-oriented thinking are two different approaches to problem-solving and planning. While strategic thinking focuses on long-term goals, holistic perspectives, and the overall direction of a project or organization, task-oriented thinking emphasizes short-term goals, specific actions, and efficient execution of tasks. Here are some distinctions between strategic and task-oriented thinking, along with examples:

Strategic Thinking:
1. Long-term focus: Strategic thinking concentrates on setting and achieving long-term objectives and envisioning the desired future state. Example: A business owner plans to expand their company geographically over the next five years.
2. Holistic perspective: Strategic thinkers consider the whole picture, including external factors, competition, market trends, and potential risks. Example: A marketing manager analyzes competitors, consumer demands, and market trends before outlining a comprehensive marketing strategy.
3. Adaptability: Strategic thinking involves anticipating possible changes and developing contingency plans. Example: A CEO devises a diversification strategy to reduce dependency on one product line after assessing market shifts and potential threats.
4. Innovation and creativity: Strategic thinkers look for new opportunities and unconventional solutions to seize competitive advantages. Example: An R&D director explores emerging technologies to develop innovative products to increase market share in their industry.

Task-Oriented Thinking:
1. Short-term focus: Task-oriented thinking emphasizes immediate objectives, frequently breaking down complex goals into smaller, achievable tasks. Example: A project manager breaks down the project into several milestones, delegating individual tasks to team members.
2. Details and execution: Task-oriented thinkers concentrate on the specifics of tasks, focusing on efficient execution and completion. Example: A software developer focuses on writing efficient code, following coding standards, and debugging to deliver a functional feature.
3. Technical expertise: Task-oriented thinking often requires specific skills and knowledge related to individual tasks or roles. Example: An accountant leverages their expertise in tax laws and regulations to complete tax filings accurately and on time.
4. Monitoring and control: Task-oriented thinkers track performance, deadlines, and resources to ensure tasks are completed as planned. Example: A production supervisor oversees daily operations, monitoring machinery, output quality, and employee productivity.

In a well-balanced team or organization, both strategic and task-oriented thinking are essential. Strategic thinking sets the direction and long-term goals, while task-oriented thinking ensures that daily operations are efficient in achieving those goals.

When a parameter was observed to be trending outside of its control limits, the candidate used their knowledge of P&IDs, equipment degradation mechanisms, restriction orifices, and process control instrumentation to diagnose the root cause of the deviation. any tips if i dont kno the specific job that I'm applying for

If you do not know the specific job that you are applying for, you can still write a compelling introduction by focusing on your skills and experience.

Here are some tips:

1. Highlight your transferrable skills: Think about the skills that you have gained through your past experiences that can be applied to a variety of different jobs. Focus on skills such as communication, problem-solving, and organization that are valuable in any workplace.

2. Describe your experience: Even if you are not sure what job you are applying for, you likely have past work experience that can be useful in a variety of roles. Describe your experience in a way that highlights the most important skills you have developed.

3. Show your passion: Regardless of the specific job, most employers are looking for candidates who are passionate about their work. Use your introduction to convey your enthusiasm for the field and your commitment to doing great work.

4. Customize your introduction: While you may not know the specific job you are applying for, you can still customize your introduction to the company and industry. Research the company and think about how your skills and experience align with their values and goals. Tailor your introduction to show why you would be a great fit for their organization.

Sure! Here are the typical parts of a resume:

1. Contact Information:
Include your full name, phone number, email address and, if applicable, your mailing address.

2. Resume Summary or Objective:
This is a brief statement, usually 2-3 sentences, that summarizes your qualifications and explains why you're the ideal candidate for the position.

3. Work Experience:
This section should detail your professional experience, starting from your most recent or current position. Include the company name, duration of employment, and job title. Focus on your accomplishments and highlight how your work contributed to your employer's success.

4. Education:
Include your degrees or certifications, the institutions you attended, and the date of graduation or expected graduation.

5. Skills:

7. Professional References:
List any professional references you have and their contact information. Make sure you ask their permission before including them in your resume.

Keep in mind that the organization and content of your resume can vary based on your industry, level of experience, and the job you're applying for.

conversation.content:
Question 4: Sometimes when using logistic regression, we need a prediction for Y that is either a 0 or a 1, rather than a probability. One way to create a prediction like this is to predict 1 whenever the probability is above ½ and to predict 0 otherwise. In this question, we will see that when logistic regression is used in this way, it is what is called a linear classifier — the feature vectors where it predicts 1 can be separated from those where it predicts 0 via a line. Linear classifiers are an important tool in machine learning.
a. Suppose we have fitted logistic regression to data using two covariates X1 and X2 and have a prediction that P(Y=1 | X1, X2) = L(β0_hat+β1_hatX1+β2_hatX2) where β0_hat=0, β1_hat=1 and β2_hat=2. Generate 1000 datapoints where X1 and X2 are both uniformly distributed between -1 and 1. Then, for each datapoint, using X1 as the horizontal axis and X2 as the vertical axis, plot it in blue if the predicted value P(Y=1 | X1, X2) is above ½ and plot it in black if the predicted value is below ½. To plot a collection of datapoints in a particular color, you can use the python code:
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
plt.plot(x1,x2,’.’,color=’blue’)
where ‘blue’ can be replaced by ‘black’.
b. You may have noticed in (a) that a line separated the blue points from the black points. This is also true for generic fitted values of β0_hat, β1_hat and β2_hat: there is a line that separates the feature vectors whose predicted probability is above ½ from those that are below ½. Write an inequality of the form aX1 + bX2 >= c that is satisfied when the predicted probability is above ½ and is not satisfied when it is below ½.
Hint: to generate a vector of n uniform random variables between a and b, begin by generating n uniform(0,1) random variables via np.random.rand(n). Then multiply by (b-a) and add a to get n uniform(a,b) random variables. Or, you can use the function np.random.uniform.

a. The code to generate the 1000 datapoints and plot them in blue or black is:

```python
import numpy as np
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

n = 1000
X1 = np.random.uniform(-1, 1, n)
X2 = np.random.uniform(-1, 1, n)

beta0_hat = 0
beta1_hat = 1
beta2_hat = 2

def logistic(z):
    return 1 / (1 + np.exp(-z))

def predicted_probability(x1, x2, b0, b1, b2):
    return logistic(b0 + b1*x1 + b2*x2)

# Classify and separate datapoints
above_half = []
below_half = []

for x1, x2 in zip(X1, X2):
    prob = predicted_probability(x1, x2, beta0_hat, beta1_hat, beta2_hat)
    if prob > 0.5:
        above_half.append((x1, x2))
    else:
        below_half.append((x1, x2))

# Convert lists of tuples to numpy arrays
above_half = np.array(above_half)
below_half = np.array(below_half)

# Plot the datapoints
plt.plot(above_half[:, 0], above_half[:, 1], '.', color='blue')
plt.plot(below_half[:, 0], below_half[:, 1], '.', color='black')
plt.xlabel('X1')
plt.ylabel('X2')
plt.show()
```

b. The inequality that determines if the predicted probability is above ½ is:

(β0_hat + β1_hat * X1 + β2_hat * X2) >= 0

Since the logistic function is greater than 0.5 when its input is greater than or equal to 0, we can write the inequality based on the logistic regression formula:

L(β0_hat + β1_hat * X1 + β2_hat * X2) > 0.5

logistic(z) > 0.5 when z >= 0, so:

(β0_hat + β1_hat * X1 + β2_hat * X2) >= 0

Question 5
In class we talked about an example from an Instagram experiment where the errors in a linear regression model were correlated because some users participating in the experiment shared a common location and were interacting with the app at a similar time.
To understand this, suppose that the outcome in the experiment is
Yi = β0 + β1 X + εi
where i indexes users participating in the experiment and X is whether the user saw the improved version of the Instagram app (X=1 if they did, 0 if they didn’t).
Suppose that users from several different cities are involved in the experiment, and that all of the users in a single city are affected by some common sources of randomness – the weather in that city, local events, attitudes and interests that are specific to people in that city.
For each city c in the experiment, let Zc be an independent normal random variable with mean 0 and variance 1 representing this common source of randomness for people in city c.
In addition, each individual i is affected by a separate source of randomness that is specific to them. Let this be Wi, and suppose this is an independent normal random variable with mean 0 and variance σ^2.
Then let εi = Zc(i) + Wi, where c(i) is the city in which individual i lives.
a. Calculate the mean and variance of εi in terms of σ^2.
b. Calculate the covariance between εi and εj  in terms of σ^2 for two individuals i and j in different cities.
c. Calculate the covariance between εi and εj  in terms of σ^2 for two individuals i and j in the same city.
d. Compute the correlation between eps[i] and eps[j] in the code above for two individuals in the same city. Recall that the correlation is Cov(eps[i], eps[j]) / sqrt( Var(eps[i]) Var(eps[j]).
You should see that (c) and (d) are not 0, which tells us that the errors are not independent. This data would then violate the assumptions in linear regression if we did a regression with the covariate X where the noise is εi.
Hint: To help you in (a), (b) and (c), it may be useful to recall the following facts about variance and covariance:
Var[A] = Cov(A,A)
Var[A+B] = Var[A]+Var[B]+2Cov[A,B]
Cov[A + B,C] = Cov[A,C] + Cov[B,C]
Cov[aA,B] = a Cov[A,B]    if a is deterministic
Cov[A,B] = 0   if A and B are independent

a. We want to find the mean and variance of εi.

Mean:
E[εi] = E[Zc(i) + Wi] = E[Zc(i)] + E[Wi] = 0 + 0 = 0

Variance:
Var[εi] = Var[Zc(i) + Wi] = Var[Zc(i)] + Var[Wi] + 2Cov[Zc(i), Wi]

Since Zc(i) and Wi are independent, their covariance is 0, so:

Var[εi] = Var[Zc(i)] + Var[Wi] = 1 + σ^2

b. We want to find the covariance between εi and εj for two individuals i and j in different cities.

Cov[εi, εj] = Cov[Zc(i) + Wi, Zc(j) + Wj] = Cov[Zc(i), Zc(j)] + Cov[Zc(i), Wj] + Cov[Wi, Zc(j)] + Cov[Wi, Wj]

Since Zc(i) and Zc(j) are independent for different cities (i ≠ j), and Wi, Wj and Zc(k) are also independent, their covariance is 0, so:

Cov[εi, εj] = 0

c. We want to find the covariance between εi and εj for two individuals i and j in the same city.

Cov[εi, εj] = Cov[Zc(i) + Wi, Zc(j) + Wj] = Cov[Zc(i), Zc(j)] + Cov[Zc(i), Wj] + Cov[Wi, Zc(j)] + Cov[Wi, Wj]

Since Zc(i) = Zc(j) for individuals in the same city, we have:

Cov[Zc(i), Zc(j)] = Var[Zc(i)] = 1

Also, Zc(i), Wi, and Wj are independent, so their covariance is 0:

Cov[εi, εj] = 1 + 0 + 0 + 0 = 1

d. We want to compute the correlation between εi and εj for two individuals i and j in the same city.

Corr[εi, εj] = Cov[εi, εj] / sqrt(Var[εi] * Var[εj])

From parts (a) and (c), we know Var[εi] = Var[εj] = 1 + σ^2, and Cov[εi, εj] = 1.

Corr[εi, εj] = 1 / sqrt((1 + σ^2) * (1 + σ^2)) = 1 / (1 + σ^2)

Since Corr[εi, εj] is not 0, the errors are not independent, and this violates the assumptions of linear regression.

This question continues Question 4 and applies it to realistic data.
Data was generated from the setting described by Question 4 for two cities using the following code:
individuals_per_city = 1000
n = 2 * individuals_per_city # number of datapoints
is_city1 = 1.0*(np.arange(n) <= individuals_per_city)
z = np.random.randn(2)
w = 0.1*np.random.randn(n)
eps = is_city1 * z[0] + (1-is_city1) * z[1] + w
# Generates an array of random 0s and 1s
x = np.random.choice([0,1], size=n)
y = 1.2 + x*0.4 + eps
df = pd.DataFrame({'x' : x, 'y' : y, 'is_city1': is_city1})
a. What value of σ^2 would you use when applying the formulas from Question 5 to compute variance, covariance, and correlation for the data generated by the code above? When you plug this number into the formula from Question 5d, you should get a number close to 1. The formula for 5d is Corr(εi, εj) = 1 / (1 + σ^2).
b. Data generated using the code above is saved in HW8_instagram.csv.  Fit a linear regression model to y with an intercept and the covariate x. Show model’s output. Then make and show an autocorrelation plot for the residuals. You should see a correlation at lag 1 that is large (i.e., close to 1), almost as large as plugging in the value of σ2 from (a) into Question 5d. This is because most pairs of individuals one lag apart are in the same city. At larger lags, the correlation should also be very large, though slightly smaller than at lag 1, because individuals a larger number of lags apart are a little bit less likely to be in the same city. If we saw this in practice, we would know there is a problem.
c. Fit a linear model like in (f) but add is_city1 as a covariate.Show model’s output. Then make and show an autocorrelation plot for the residuals. You should see that autocorrelation at lags > 0 go away. This is because the residuals now approximate Wi, which is independent across individuals, not Zc(i) + Wi. You should also see that the R2 gets better.
d. Based only on looking at the code, what is the impact of the improved version of the Instagram app on the outcome Y? If you didn’t have access to this code, how could you get an estimate of this impact from the linear regression output from (c)?

a. In the code above, we can see that w = 0.1*np.random.randn(n). Since the variance of a standard normal random variable is 1, the variance of w is (0.1)^2 = 0.01. So, σ^2 = 0.01. When we plug this number into the formula from Question 5d, we get:

Corr(εi, εj) = 1 / (1 + σ^2) = 1 / (1 + 0.01) ≈ 0.9901

b. First, let's load the HW8_instagram.csv file, fit a linear regression model and plot the autocorrelation plot for the residuals.

```python
import pandas as pd
import numpy as np
from sklearn.linear_model import LinearRegression
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
from statsmodels.graphics.tsaplots import plot_acf

df = pd.read_csv('HW8_instagram.csv')
X = df['x'].values.reshape((-1, 1))
y = df['y'].values

# Fit linear regression model
reg = LinearRegression().fit(X, y)

# Print intercept and coefficient
print('Intercept:', reg.intercept_)
print('Coefficient:', reg.coef_[0])

# Calculate residuals
residuals = y - reg.predict(X)

# Plot the autocorrelation
plot_acf(residuals)
plt.xlabel('lag')
plt.ylabel('autocorrelation at lag')
plt.show()
```

c. Now, let's fit a linear regression model with is_city1 as an additional covariate and plot the autocorrelation of the residuals.

```python
X_extended = df[['x', 'is_city1']].values

# Fit linear regression model
reg_extended = LinearRegression().fit(X_extended, y)

# Print intercept and coefficients
print('Intercept:', reg_extended.intercept_)
print('Coefficients:', reg_extended.coef_)

# Calculate residuals
residuals_extended = y - reg_extended.predict(X_extended)

# Plot the autocorrelation of the residuals
plot_acf(residuals_extended)
plt.xlabel('lag')
plt.ylabel('autocorrelation at lag')
plt.show()
```

d. Based on the code, the impact of the improved version of the Instagram app on the outcome Y is given by the coefficient multiplying the variable x, which is 0.4. If we didn't have access to this code, we could estimate this impact from the linear regression output from part (c) by looking at the coefficient of the 'x' variable in the fitted model. In this case, the value should be close to 0.4.

how to get a better chance to work in the USA

Here are 5 steps to increase your chances of working in the USA:

1. Research the job market: Learn about the job market in the USA by researching job boards, company websites, and networking with professionals in your field. Identify the companies that you're interested in working for and research their hiring processes.

2. Obtain the necessary visa: If you're not a citizen or permanent resident of the USA, you'll need to obtain a work visa. You can visit the U.S. Citizenship and Immigration Services website to learn more about the different types of work visas available.

3. Build a strong resume and cover letter: Create a resume and cover letter that showcases your relevant work experience, education, and skills. Be sure to tailor your materials to each job you apply for.

4. Network: Attend job fairs, networking events, and meetups in your industry to connect with professionals and potential employers. Reach out to people in your field on LinkedIn and create a professional network.

5. Prepare for interviews: Research the company and the role you're applying for, and practice answering common interview questions. Be sure to dress professionally and arrive on time for interviews.

Additionally, here are some extra tips that can help you increase your chances to work in the USA:

6. Improve your language skills: English is the primary language spoken in the USA, so it's important to have a strong command of the language. Consider taking English classes or practicing speaking with native speakers.

7. Gain relevant work experience: Gain work experience in your field either in your home country or in the USA. Having experience that is relevant to the job you're applying for can make you a more competitive candidate.

8. Get additional education or certification: Consider getting additional education or certifications that are relevant to your field to make yourself a more attractive candidate to employers.

9. Be flexible on job location: Be open to working in different areas of the USA. There may be more job opportunities available in certain regions, and being flexible on location can give you an edge.

10. Stay positive: The job search process can be long and frustrating, but it's important to stay positive and keep trying. A positive attitude can help you stand out from other candidates and make a good impression on potential employers.

conversation.content: can you rewrite a resume to make it more appealing?

As an AI language model, I'm capable of helping with rewriting a resume to make it more appealing. Here's an example of how I can improve it:

Before:

Name: John Doe
Objective: To obtain a job in the field of marketing.
Experience:
- Marketing assistant at XYZ Company for two years
- Sales representative at ABC Company for one year
Education:
- Bachelor's degree in Marketing from ABC University

After:

Name: John Doe
Professional Summary: Marketing specialist with over three years of experience in driving revenue growth and brand awareness for diverse organizations. Skilled in identifying lucrative business opportunities and delivering compelling marketing campaigns that engage customers.
Experience:
- Marketing Assistant at XYZ Company, Seattle, WA (2019-2021)
    - Demonstrated expertise in executing successful digital marketing campaigns, increasing website traffic by 50% and generating $100K in sales revenue.
    - Collaborated with cross-functional teams to develop and implement marketing strategies for new product launches, resulting in a 30% increase in market share.
- Sales Representative at ABC Company, Portland, OR (2018-2019)
    - Consistently exceeded quarterly sales goals by 20% through effective sales techniques and outstanding customer service.
    - Conducted market research and analyzed customer needs to identify new sales opportunities and develop customized solutions for clients.
Education:
- Bachelor of Science in Marketing, ABC University, Seattle, WA (2018)

By doing this, I added a professional summary that highlights the candidate's skills, achievements, and experience. I also restructured the experience section to focus on specific accomplishments and added metrics and results to quantify the impact of the candidate's work. Finally, I made sure to use action-oriented language and keywords relevant to the field of marketing to capture the attention of employers.

write a bid for a full stack developer position.

conversation.content:
write a bid on this "No agencies, only individuals

We are looking for a talented and passionate Full Stack developer to join our team - INDIVIDUALS, not COMPANIES! As a developer, you will be responsible for developing, and maintaining a hybrid mobile app that meets the needs of our clients. You will work closely with product managers, and designers to ensure the app meets the highest standards of quality and usability.

Responsibilities:

1. Develop a website, develop and maintain a mobile app

Only work with this stack !!!
Backend: Node.js + TypeScript zB mit Supabase
Frontend: React + Ionic

Write clean, well-documented, and efficient code
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to identify and prioritize features
Ensure the app meets the highest standards of quality and usability
Troubleshoot and debug issues
Stay up-to-date with emerging trends and technologies in software development

Requirements:

Proven experience as a software developer
Links to ready apps that you worked on, candidates without ready app links won't be shortlisted!
Strong problem-solving skills
Excellent communication and collaboration skills"

Dear Hiring Manager,

I am submitting my bid for the Full Stack developer position that you advertised. Please note that I am an individual, not an agency or a company, and I possess the skills and experience required to successfully complete the job.

I have a proven track record as a software developer with ample experience working on Node.js, TypeScript, Supabase, React and Ionic stack. In addition, I have developed and maintained a range of mobile applications that are currently live on different platforms. You can check some of these apps by following the links provided below:

- App 1
- App 2
- App 3

I am a detail-oriented, self-motivated, and collaborative individual who possesses strong problem-solving skills. My excellent communication and collaboration skills make me confident that I can work effectively with cross-functional teams to identify, prioritize, and execute on features, ensuring high-quality work that meets the needs of clients.

My technical qualifications and experience include:

- Proven experience in mobile app development using React Native and Ionic
- Expertise in Node.js, TypeScript, Supabase stack
- Experienced with Agile methodologies and JIRA
- Strong problem-solving and debugging abilities
- Excellent communication and collaboration skills
- Ability to write clean, well-documented, and efficient code

I am available to start immediately, and I am excited about the opportunity to work with your team. Thank you for your consideration, and I look forward to hearing from you.

Sincerely,

[Your Name]

conversations.facetValue: receive feedback and more specific technical skills for their CV, with a focus on civil engineering.

English
provide feedback and additional relevant information for a Civil Engineer CV.

conversation.content: what is a cv should contain

A CV (Curriculum Vitae) should contain the following information:

1. Personal Information: Full name, address, phone number, email address, and a professional photograph (if required)
2. Objective Statement: A brief statement that summarizes your career goals and the type of job you are seeking
3. Education and Qualifications: Name of the schools or universities attended, degree(s) earned, and any certificates, licenses or qualifications relevant to the position being sought
4. Work Experience: A detailed account of your work history, including job titles, responsibilities, dates of employment, and achievements (use bullet points to show impact and relevance).
5. Skills: Relevant skills you possess such as technical skills, language skills, computer skills, project management skills, etc.
6. Achievements and Awards: Awards or recognitions earned, published papers or research work done.
7. References: at least 2work related reference with their Full name, email address, phone number and job title.

A CV should be well structured, clear, concise and easy to read to make an impact on the potential employer.
give me example for civil engineer cv

_______________________________________

[Full Name]
[Address]

To obtain a challenging position in the field of Civil Engineering that allows me to utilize my technical expertise, problem-solving abilities and leadership skills to the fullest potential.

- High School - [Name of School], [Graduation Date]

- Good analytical and problem-solving skills

Work Experience:
[Current/Previous Employer], [City, Country], [Employment dates]
Position: Civil Engineer
Responsibilities included:
- Planning and design of site grading, drainage systems, and roadways for commercial and residential properties
- Preparation of construction drawings, specifications, and feasibility studies
- Coordinating with architects, contractors and city officials to ensure projects are completed on time and within budget
- Conducting site inspections and reviewing work to ensure compliance with design specifications and safety standards
- Managing project budgets, schedules and resources to ensure successful project delivery

[Previous Employer], [City, Country], [Employment dates]
Position: Junior Civil Engineer
Responsibilities included:
- Assisting in the design and development of structural projects for commercial and residential buildings
- Assisting in the preparation of construction drawings, specifications, and cost estimates
- Conducting field inspections and testing to ensure construction quality and compliance with design standards
- Developing and maintaining project schedules and documentation
- Collaborating with other team members to ensure successful project completion

Achievements:
- [List any notable achievements, publications, or awards]

References:
[Provide at least 2 work-related reference with their Full name, email address, phone number, and job title]

_______________________________________

Note that this is just an example and the content, style and format can vary depending on the job requirements and individual preferences.

give me more professional skill

Sure, here are some more professional skills that could be useful in various industries:

1. Project Management: Ability to oversee a project from start to finish, ensuring timely delivery, within budget and to specifications.

2. Leadership and Management: Ability to lead a team with excellent communication skills, mentoring, and motivation.

3. Creative problem-solving: Ability to identify issues, develop solutions, and implement them effectively.

4. Analytical skills: Ability to analyze complex issues and make informed decisions.

5. Attention to detail: Ability to spot and resolve errors.

6. Adaptability: Ability to cope with change and respond quickly to new situations.

7. Communication: Ability to express ideas and thoughts clearly and effectively in both verbal and written formats.

8. Time management: Ability to prioritize and manage multiple tasks efficiently.

9. Interpersonal skills: Ability to establish and maintain positive relationships with clients, colleagues, and other stakeholders.

10. Technical Skills: Ability to operate specific tools or machines required for a specific job or industry.

These are some important professional skills that could add value to your CV and make you stand out in the job market.
skills more meant by a civil engineer job not a general skill

Sure, here are some technical skills that would be more relevant to a Civil Engineer job:

1. Proficiency in CAD (computer-aided design) software, including AutoCAD, MicroStation or Revit.

2. Sound knowledge of civil engineering principles including mechanics, materials science, and thermodynamics.

3. Strong understanding of building codes and construction regulations and standards.

4. Ability to conduct and analyze geotechnical assessments and soil tests.

5. Familiarity with mathematical tools like Calculus, Algebra, and Probability.

6. Knowledge of environmental regulations and guidelines related to the construction industry.

7. Experience with traffic flow and transportation planning, including traffic engineering software.

8. Knowledge of construction management techniques such as scheduling, budgeting, and quality control.

9. Familiarity with construction materials and their properties.

10. Awareness of project delivery methods such as design-bid-build, design-build, and construction management at-risk.

be more specific

Sure, here are some specific technical skills that would be relevant to a Civil Engineer job:

1. Proficiency in civil engineering design software like AutoCAD, Civil 3D, MicroStation or Revit.

2. Sound knowledge of concrete and steel design, including reinforced concrete and pre-stressed concrete.

3. Competence with Finite Element Method software for structural design analysis, such as SAP 2000, ETABS, or ANSYS.

4. Experience with hydrologic and hydraulic modeling software for watershed studies, stormwater management, flood plain analysis, and erosion control, like HEC-RAS, HY-8 or SWMM.

5. Familiarity with geotechnical software for slope stability analysis, foundation design, and soil mechanics, such as GRLWEAP, Slope/w, Plaxis, or GeoStudio.

6. Knowledge of construction materials and their properties, including concrete mix designs, asphalt pavements, and structural steel, and nondestructive testing methods, such as ultrasonic, visual or radiographic.

7. Experience with transportation engineering software for capacity analysis, safety analysis, signal timing, and transit planning, like VISSIM, SYNCHRO, SIDRA TRIP or AutoTURN.

8. Understanding of environmental regulations and guidelines related to stormwater management, wetland mitigation, and air quality permitting for construction sites.

9. Ability to use project management software, such as Primavera or Microsoft Project, for project scheduling, cost estimation, and resource allocation.

10. Awareness of sustainable design principles, such as Leadership in Energy and Environmental Design (LEED) certification, green building codes, and energy modeling software, like EnergyPlus, IES or eQUEST.

These are some of the specific technical skills that would be relevant to a Civil Engineer job, and they may vary depending on the job requirements and employer expectations. Make sure to highlight your expertise in these areas in your CV to increase your chances of getting hired for the position.

Title: Multi-Trade Construction Worker Wanted – London & Brighton

Are you a talented, self-starter with a range of construction skills and experience? Do you pride yourself on delivering quality workmanship, and are you willing to travel between London and Brighton for various projects? If so, we want to hear from you!

We are an established construction company, seeking an experienced and skilled multi-trade construction worker to join our team. Our ideal candidate will have a strong preference for roofing, but all-round knowledge and ability to work on diverse aspects of construction projects would be highly beneficial.

Responsibilities:

- Carry out a wide range of construction tasks, including roofing, carpentry, plumbing, and more.
- Ensure all work is carried out to the highest standard and adheres to safety regulations.
- Work as part of a team, but able to complete tasks efficiently and independently when required.
- Communicate effectively with clients, colleagues, and management.
- Be punctual, reliable, and able to meet deadlines.
- Travel between London and Brighton as needed for various projects.

Requirements:

- A minimum of 3 years' experience working in a multi-trade construction role, preferably with roofing experience.
- Full UK driving license and access to own van for transportation of tools and equipment.
- Possess a comprehensive set of tools necessary for completing varied construction tasks.
- Flexibility to work across various locations, with a willingness to travel between London and Brighton.
- Strong problem-solving skills and the ability to complete tasks effectively and efficiently.
- A team player with a positive attitude and excellent communication skills.
- Required qualifications, such as CSCS card and relevant trade certifications.

What we offer:

- Competitive day rate ranging from £140 - £180 (based on experience and qualifications).
- The opportunity to work within a supportive and experienced team.
- Varied projects, offering the chance to expand and develop your skills.
- A friendly and professional working environment.

If you meet the requirements and believe you would be the right fit for this position, please submit your CV and a brief cover letter explaining why you would be the ideal candidate for this role. We look forward to speaking with you and potentially welcoming you to our team!

(Job reference: MTW-LB-001)

conversations.facetValue: improve and refine their application for the position of Implementatieadviseur TriasWeb.

allFacetValues.value: improve and refine their application for the position of Implementatieadviseur TriasWeb.
English
improve a resume and cover letter.

conversation.content:
Verbeter deze sollicitatiebrief:

Hi Pim,

Ik mail u naar aanleiding van de vacature "Implementatieadviseur TriasWeb". Ik liep toevallig langs jullie kantoor in Nijmegen toen het gevoel me bekroop dat dit wel eens precies de plek kan zijn waar ik naar op zoek ben.


 

Ik stel me graag even voor; mijn naam is Fabian van der Niet, ik ben 31 jaar en op zoek naar een bedrijf die Zorg en Software samenbrengt. Ik ben namelijk opgeleid als HBO Vaktherapeut, maar merkte al snel dat ik ook veel passie heb voor het bieden van zorg middels software. Tijdens het afronden van de opleiding ben ik me dan ook gaan verdiepen in softwaredesign (UI/UX) en het aanleren van HTML/CSS/JS. Dit met als doel, een app te kunnen maken voor persoonlijke ontwikkeling: "innerDex". Indertijd heb ik ook als verkoopadviseur gewerkt in een Apple store, uiteraard met de nodige targets.

 

"innerDex" is nog steeds mijn passie-project, maar ik ben mij professioneel gaan ontwikkelen als bedrijf/marketing-adviseur, softwaredesigner en product manager bij verschillende opdrachtgevers. Dit deed ik uitsluitend bij opdrachtgevers die gemoeid waren met (mentale) zorg, aangezien dat aansluit bij mijn gevoel van zingeving.

 

Ik ben altijd happig om professioneel door te ontwikkelen. Vanuit deze ervaring zal ik dan ook, middels het STAP-budget, in mei een certificaat product-owner (PSPO-1) binnenhalen. (een PO is iemand die met stakeholders in gesprek gaat en de productontwikkeling stuurt op basis van prioriteiten). 

 

Inmiddels heb ik jaren ervaring in de combinatie zorg&software, en ben ik op zoek naar een nieuwe uitdaging om me in vast te bijten. Jullie bedrijf spreekt me dan ook ontzettend aan! Ik ben op zoek naar iets dat aansluit bij mijn ervaring, maar me ook iets nieuws kan leren. Daarom zou ik graag eens met jullie in gesprek gaan over de functie "Implementatieadviseur TriasWeb".

 

Als implementatieadviseur bij Triaspect krijg ik de kans om niet met stakeholders, maar juist met de eindgebruikers in gesprek te gaan. Een groot deel van mijn werkzaamheden afgelopen jaren bestond al uit het mondeling begeleiden bij het gebruik van de software-functionaliteiten, waar ik veel plezier in had. Zodra ik in jullie software ben gedoken, vermoed ik ook daar veel voldoening uit te halen. Ieder zorgteam is anders, en ik kan me voorstellen dat ik me bezig zal houden met het (uit)vinden van de beste oplossingen voor de problemen waar teams tegenaanlopen mbt de implementatie van de software. Mijn bewezen geduld, scherpte in bewoordingen en kwaliteiten in het "zien van the bigger picture" zal in de gesprekken met klanten/gebruikers goed van pas komen.

 

Bij deze functie lijkt de nadruk te liggen op het onderhouden van klant-relaties, het helpen wegwijs maken in de software en, waar mogelijk, het realiseren van aanvullende acquisitie. Dit zijn allen werkzaamheden waar ik mijn huidige ervaring en kwaliteiten goed in kwijt kan, maar me ook nog graag in zou ontwikkelen.

 

Wat mij nog het meest enthousiasmeert, is de gewenste betrokkenheid bij de productontwikkeling. Daarin zal mijn ervaring en expertise het meest tot z'n recht komen. Het betekent dat ik niet alleen kansen moet gaan zien die zorgen dat klanten meer waarde uit onze hoofdsoftware en aanvullende producten haalt, maar ook kansen om de software nog beter/gebruiksvriendelijker te maken. Daar kan ik mijn ervaring als softwaredesigner en product manager gebruiken om -nu vanuit het perspectief van de gebruiker- suggesties voor innovaties aan te leveren.

 

Al met al lijkt deze vacature een perfecte balans te zijn tussen het inzetten van mijn kwaliteiten en het professioneel ontwikkelen op nieuwe gebieden. Maar laten we beginnen bij het kopje koffie.

 

U zult inmiddels vast kennis genomen hebben van mijn gepassioneerde karakter. Die komt alleen vrij als iets mij oprecht interesseert. De functie sluit aan bij wat ik wil bijdragen aan de wereld. Daarnaast kan ik hier ontwikkelen op nog onbegane gebieden, en vermoed ik jullie veel te kunnen bieden, mogelijk op nog onvoorziene wijze.

 

Ik zou graag eens met u in gesprek gaan om te ontdekken of dat waar is, en of we daar hetzelfde over denken.

 

Ik kijk uit naar een ontmoeting!

 

Met hartelijke groet,

Fabian van der Niet

Beste Pim,

Via deze weg wil ik u informeren over mijn interesse in de vacature “Implementatieadviseur TriasWeb”. Tijdens mijn wandeling langs jullie kantoor in Nijmegen, besefte ik dat deze baan wel eens de perfecte match zou kunnen zijn voor mijn ambities en vaardigheden.

Graag stel ik mezelf even voor; mijn naam is Fabian van der Niet, ik ben 31 jaar en ik zoek naar een bedrijf dat de werelden van zorg en software verenigt. Als afgestudeerd HBO Vaktherapeut en liefhebber van zorg, ontdekte ik een andere passie in het bieden van zorg via software. Zo ben ik mij gaan verdiepen in softwaredesign (UI/UX) en het aanleren van HTML/CSS/JS tijdens het afronden van mijn opleiding. Met als resultaat: de ontwikkeling van mijn eigen app voor persoonlijke groei, genaamd “innerDex”. Na mijn werk als verkoopadviseur bij een Apple store, waar targets centraal stonden, richtte ik mij op freelance werk als bedrijfs/marketingadviseur, softwaredesigner en productmanager die zich enkel en alleen bezighielden in de (mentale) zorgsector omdat deze het beste aansloten bij mijn gevoel van voldoening.

Met een ruime ervaring in de combinatie van zorg en software, ben ik nu op zoek naar een nieuwe uitdaging bij Triaspect. Het Certificaat Product Owner (PSPO-1), dat ik via het STAP-budget in mei wil behalen, zie ik als een waardevolle toevoeging aan mijn professionele ontwikkeling. Een rol als Implementatieadviseur geeft mij, naast het werken met stakeholders, de kans om in contact te komen met eindgebruikers. In de afgelopen jaren heb ik veel ervaring opgedaan in het mondeling begeleiden van gebruikers bij het gebruik van software-functionaliteiten en ik verwacht dit met veel plezier ook voor jullie software te kunnen doen. Ik ben ervan overtuigd dat het werken met verschillende zorgteams zal leiden tot het vinden van de meest effectieve oplossingen voor de uitdagingen die zij ondervinden bij de implementatie van de software. Mijn bewezen vaardigheden in geduldige, nauwkeurige bewoordingen en de kwaliteit om het grotere plaatje te zien, zijn zeer waardevol in gesprekken met klanten en gebruikers.

In deze baan zal ik mij vooral bezighouden met het onderhouden van goede klantrelaties, het wegwijs maken van gebruikers in de software en het realiseren van aanvullende acquisitie. Deze werkzaamheden waardeer ik zeer en zie ik als een kans om mijn huidige vaardigheden in te zetten en nieuwe te ontwikkelen. Wat mij een extra boost geeft, is de betrokkenheid bij de productontwikkeling. Hier kan ik mijn ervaring als softwaredesigner en productmanager inzetten om, vanuit het perspectief van de gebruiker, suggesties te doen voor innovatie en verbetering.

Kortom, de vacature van Implementatieadviseur bij Triaspect lijkt de perfecte balans te zijn tussen het gebruiken van mijn huidige vaardigheden en het ontwikkelen van nieuwe. Ik ben enthousiast om met jullie te ontmoeten om te ontdekken of wij dezelfde verwachtingen en doelen hebben.

Graag een kop koffie om nader kennis te maken!

Met vriendelijke groet,

Fabian van der Niet

conversation.content:
Please write a cover letter using the following job posting, resume, and information about me:
Job posting:
Motion Graphics/Video Editor.
Animation skills are a plus.
Please submit a portfolio with your Resume.
Must be within driving distance of Appleton. Relocation assistance is not available.
This is not a remote position.

Looking for an experienced Motion Graphics/Animator to join our team in Appleton WI.

Must be able to commute to Appleton, WI.

Relocation is not available.

This is not a remote position.

The John Birch Society is in search of a full-time motion graphics/editor to join the media production department. The ideal person will work with project leaders and provide input during the entire production process.

Position Overview

The majority of the responsibilities will include putting together weekly programs along with shooting and editing footage for documentary-style videos and animations.
This will include setting up for interviews, gathering b-roll, creating motion graphics, acquiring stock footage, audio mixing, and of course editing video for distribution.
This person will be using TriCaster for a majority of the weekly shows along with a wide variety of professional programs such as Premiere, After Effects, and Photoshop.
This person must be creative and be able to create motion graphics.
They will also need great organizational and communication skills as they will be working as part of a team.

Other Responsibilities Would Be

Working knowledge of DSLR cameras and professional camcorders.
Working knowledge of live video switcher and Adobe Premiere.
Produce original videos and create motion graphics.
Acquiring or purchasing stock or news footage.
Configure lighting setups for recording scenarios.
Choose appropriate audio setups and recording styles.
Coordinate and direct on-camera talent.
Log, transfer, and convert video.
Format content for social media and video platforms, websites, and future apps.
Ability to multitask and assist in the creation of multiple visual projects in a short timeline while working in a team environment.

Experience
Adobe Creative Suite:
Premiere.
Photoshop.
After Effects.
Knowledge of TriCaster is a plus.

Benefits For This Full-time Employment Include

Life, Health, Vision & Dental Insurance options.
Paid Vacation.
401(k) Plan.
Paid Holidays.

To Be Considered For This Position You MUST Have

Demo Reel or Link to Samples.
Must be able to work at Headquarters in Appleton, WI.

Applicants that do not meet the above requirements will not be considered.

Must be within driving distance of Appleton. Relocation assistance is not available.

The position we are hiring for will be editing some of our weekly content while also working on special projects that utilize motion graphics. Dear Hiring Manager,

I am writing to express my interest in the Motion Graphics/Video Editor position at The John Birch Society, as referenced in your recent job posting. With over three years of experience in storytelling, video editing, and motion design, I believe I possess the creativity, technical skills, and keen understanding of the production process that make me an ideal candidate for this role. Having recently returned to the United States after spending nine years in China, I am eager to contribute my versatile skill set to an organization that values promoting a positive community culture through captivating visual content.

I hold a BA in Film Studies and a BFA in Film Production from the University of Colorado, which have equipped me with a sophisticated understanding of visual storytelling techniques and provided me with hands-on experience using professional programs like Premiere, After Effects, and Photoshop, as mentioned in your job requirements. As a multi-disciplinary creative professional, I am experienced with video editing, 2D & 3D motion design, copywriting, graphic design, and additional platforms within the Adobe Creative Suite such as Illustrator, XD, and Blender 3D.

My professional background includes working as a Game Writer & Content Creator at Mechanist Games and a Content Designer at 17Zuoye, where I routinely produced engaging digital content under tight deadlines. In these roles, I localized and proofread marketing copy, wrote and edited promotional videos, storyboarded commercials, and collaborated with cross-functional teams to create digital publications and social media content. Additionally, I have experience working with various cameras and video switchers, coordinating and directing on-camera talent, and formatting content for multiple platforms.

Moreover, I believe my strong organizational and communication skills make me an excellent fit for a collaborative team environment. I am highly proficient in working on multiple visual projects simultaneously and coordinating with diverse stakeholders to ensure projects are delivered on schedule and meet high-quality standards.

In compliance with your requirements, I am within driving distance of Appleton and prepared to work on-site at your headquarters. Please find my resume, demo reel, and portfolio at makarah.net, demonstrating my experience and proficiency in creating motion graphics and editing video content.

Thank you for considering my application. I look forward to the opportunity to discuss how my skills and experiences can contribute to the success of The John Birch Society's media production department.

Sincerely,

[Your Name]

Burleigh Heads, Gold Coast QLD

CULTURE THAT CRUSHES IT

Our mission at F45 is to create the world’s greatest workout. This isn’t only about creating an unbelievable fitness experience—it’s about building a community and culture.

 

We are seeking a superstar Operations Manager to join our beautiful Burleigh Heads Studio: 
 

Benefits:

Flexible working schedule
Competitive salary and bonus structure
Virtual Assistant provided
Active ownership group
One of the largest F45 Studios in Australia.
 

Key Responsibilities:

Create, manage and exceed, all Sales and Operational budgets & goals
Drive financial plans and increase gross margins of the business through optimal programming and capacity utilization
Ensure all systems and studio practices/processes are adhered to.
Ensure a consistent sales effort is maintained at all times by providing daily sales goals and contests/incentive-based motivation, including establishing, expanding, and tracking outreach initiatives and strategic partnerships with local businesses, community groups, and charitable organizations
Recruit, hire, train and deliver the onboarding program for all staff
Maintain and grow the total membership base and oversee all aspects of the membership sales process
Increase studio conversion rate and achieve client retention goals
Drive client referral program
Maintain top-notch cleanliness, appearance, and organization of the studio and inventory
Demonstrate positive attitude and actions through a display of courtesy, service, cooperation, hospitality, sensitivity and professionalism to both clients and internal staff
Ensure studio branding by adhering to company guidelines and values
Maintain strong working knowledge of our small-group training programs.
Manage and oversee all day-to-day operations and overall studio performance. 
 

Qualifications:

Equivalent work experience, required
5+ years of proven sales leadership in the Health & Fitness industry required
Must have Personal Training Certification through a nationally recognized organization
Must have CPR/AED/First Aid Certification
3+ years of management experience, including directly overseeing all aspects of staff management from hiring, training, supporting, disciplining, and terminating
Must have outstanding experience delivering high-quality customer service, excellent communication, organizational, and written skills
Must possess excellent leadership and management skills to create a positive, successful environment for staff and clients
Ability to work independently and collaborate with Studio Owner, Sales Associates, and client
Highly organized with the ability to prioritize and meet deadlines
Computer proficiency with MS Office programs, MindBody Online, as well as various media platforms

conversations.facetValue: understand the roles of a cultural assistant at a university.

allFacetValues.value: understand the roles of a cultural assistant at a university.
English
provide information about the roles of a cultural assistant at a university.

conversation.content: uvic cultural assistant key roles

1. Promoting Multiculturalism: Cultural assistants play a vital role in promoting multiculturalism and diversity within the university campus. They encourage students to embrace and appreciate different cultures by organizing cultural events, workshops, and cultural exchange programs.

2. Providing Support to International Students: Cultural assistants provide support to international students by helping them navigate the new culture, providing insight into the social and academic norms, and creating a safe and inclusive environment for them.

3. Assisting in Language Learning: Cultural assistants are often bilingual or multilingual, and they assist students in language learning by organizing language exchange programs and language lab sessions. 

4. Empowering Communities: Cultural assistants work towards empowering communities by spearheading initiatives that uplift marginalized groups. They provide a voice for students who may otherwise not have one, and advocate for their needs on campus.

5. Bridging Cultural Gaps: Cultural assistants act as a bridge between different cultures, facilitating communication and understanding between students from different backgrounds. By arranging social events and activities, they provide opportunities for students to learn from each other.

6. Fostering Global Citizenship: Cultural assistants work towards creating global citizens by promoting an understanding of different cultures, encouraging empathy, and nurturing a sense of responsibility towards the planet and its inhabitants.

7. Creating an Inclusive Environment: Cultural assistants strive to create an inclusive environment by celebrating diversity, challenging stereotypes, and ensuring that everyone feels welcome on campus. They play a key role in promoting a sense of belonging and community.

conversations.facetValue: output the SQL statements executed by Spring Boot applications and how to integrate log4jdbc and Oracle UCP for logging SQL statements.

allFacetValues.value: output the SQL statements executed by Spring Boot applications and how to integrate log4jdbc and Oracle UCP for logging SQL statements.
English
integrate logging of executed SQL queries in a Spring Boot application using various techniques such as AOP and custom annotations.

conversation.content: sprintboot UCP 输出已提交的完整SQL

在使用Spring Boot时，可以通过在application.properties文件中设置日志级别和日志输出格式来输出已提交的完整SQL。

设置日志级别和日志输出格式：

```
logging.level.org.hibernate.SQL=debug
logging.pattern.console=%d{yyyy-MM-dd HH:mm:ss.SSS} %-5level %logger{36} - %msg%n
```

这将设置Hibernate SQL日志级别为debug并设置日志输出格式为时间戳、日志级别、日志名称、消息和换行符。

然后，运行应用程序并查看控制台输出，应该可以看到已提交的完整SQL。

如果您正在使用其他的持久层框架，可以将上述日志级别和日志输出格式应用于相应的持久层框架。
spring boot 集成log4jdbc、Oracle UCP

要在Spring Boot中集成log4jdbc和Oracle UCP，需要先添加以下依赖项：

```xml
<dependency>
    <groupId>com.oracle.database.jdbc</groupId>
    <artifactId>ucp</artifactId>

```

在Spring Boot中，我们可以使用以下两种方法来显示完整SQL：

1. 修改application.properties文件

在application.properties文件中添加以下属性：

```
spring.jpa.properties.hibernate.format_sql=true
```

2. 修改日志级别

在logback.xml或者log4j.properties文件中将日志级别设置为DEBUG，以便查看更详细的日志信息。例如：

logback.xml

```
<root level="debug">
  <appender-ref ref="CONSOLE"/>
</root>
```

log4j.properties

```
log4j.rootLogger=DEBUG, CONSOLE
```

这将启用Hibernate的SQL日志记录器，并记录SQL语句和参数值。

通过以上方法，我们可以很方便地显示JPA执行的完整SQL语句。

conversation.content: springboot log4jdbc oracleUCP連接池

Spring Boot和log4jdbc是两个独立的框架，用于不同的目的。Spring Boot是一个快速开发框架，用于开发基于Spring的应用程序，而log4jdbc是一个JDBC驱动程序，用于记录JDBC活动。

OracleUCP（Universal Connection Pool）是Oracle提供的一种连接池，用于管理数据库连接。它可以与log4jdbc一起使用，以提供更好的数据库连接管理和调试功能。

使用Spring Boot和log4jdbc连接Oracle数据库的步骤如下：

1. 添加OracleUCP依赖项，以使应用程序能够使用OracleUCP数据源。

2. 配置数据源，包括数据库连接信息、连接池大小等参数。

3. 配置log4jdbc数据源，并使用其包装OracleUCP数据源。

4. 在应用程序中使用log4jdbc数据源进行数据库操作，以便记录JDBC活动和调试信息。

以下是一个示例Spring Boot应用程序的配置文件，该应用程序使用log4jdbc和OracleUCP连接Oracle数据库：

```
spring.datasource.url=jdbc:oracle:thin:@//localhost:1521/ORCL
spring.datasource.username=oracle
spring.datasource.password=oracle
spring.datasource.driver-class-name=oracle.jdbc.driver.OracleDriver
spring.datasource.type=com.zaxxer.hikari.HikariDataSource
spring.datasource.hikari.connectionTimeout=20000
spring.datasource.hikari.maximumPoolSize=5
spring.datasource.hikari.minimumIdle=2

logging.level.jdbc=DEBUG
logging.level.jdbc.sqltiming=DEBUG
logging.level.jdbc.resultset=DEBUG

spring.datasource.type=org.springframework.jdbc.datasource.DriverManagerDataSource
logging.level.jdbc=DEBUG
logging.level.jdbc.sqltiming=DEBUG
logging.level.jdbc.resultset=DEBUG

jdbc.driverClassName=net.sf.log4jdbc.sql.jdbcapi.DriverSpy

oracle.ucp.jdbc.PoolDataSourceFactory=oracle.ucp.jdbc.PoolDataSourceFactoryImpl

oracle.ucp.jdbc.PoolDataSource.url=jdbc:log4jdbc:oracle:thin:@//localhost:1521/ORCL
oracle.ucp.jdbc.PoolDataSource.user=oracle
oracle.ucp.jdbc.PoolDataSource.password=oracle
oracle.ucp.jdbc.PoolDataSource.maxPoolSize=5
oracle.ucp.jdbc.PoolDataSource.minPoolSize=2
oracle.ucp.jdbc.PoolDataSource.initialPoolSize=2
oracle.ucp.jdbc.PoolDataSource.connectionWaitTimeout=120
oracle.ucp.jdbc.PoolDataSource.inactiveConnectionTimeout=180
oracle.ucp.jdbc.PoolDataSource.validateConnectionOnBorrow=true
oracle.ucp.jdbc.PoolDataSource.sqlForValidateConnection=SELECT 1 FROM DUAL
```

上面的配置文件首先配置了一个普通数据源（类型为Hikari），然后配置了log4jdbc数据源。在这种情况下，log4jdbc数据源包装Hikari数据源，并提供记录JDBC活动和调试信息的功能。

要在应用程序中使用log4jdbc数据源进行数据库操作，只需注入log4jdbc数据源，然后使用它的连接对象进行数据库操作即可。例如：

```java
@Autowired
private DataSource log4jdbcDataSource;

Connection conn = log4jdbcDataSource.getConnection();

// execute database operations using the connection
```

log4jdbc将记录与连接关联的所有JDBC操作，以便进行调试和排除故障。要查看这些日志，请将应用程序的日志级别设置为"DEBUG"，并在应用程序日志中查看JDBC操作。
springboot log4jdbc oracleUCP連接池多數據源

在Spring Boot应用程序中使用多个数据源，可以使用Spring的抽象数据源类（AbstractRoutingDataSource）。这个类允许您根据需要选择数据源，以便应用程序可以同时连接到多个数据库。

使用Spring Boot、log4jdbc和OracleUCP连接多个数据源的步骤如下：

1. 添加OracleUCP和log4jdbc的依赖项。

2. 配置每个数据源的连接信息和连接池参数，每个数据源都需要一个独立的配置文件。

3. 在配置文件中配置一个抽象数据源（AbstractRoutingDataSource），该数据源根据应用程序需要选择数据源。

4. 配置数据源路由策略，该策略根据特定标识符选择正确的数据源。

以下是一个示例Spring Boot应用程序的配置文件，该应用程序使用log4jdbc和OracleUCP连接到两个不同的Oracle数据库，并使用抽象数据源根据需要选择正确的数据源：

```
oracle.ucp.jdbc.PoolDataSource.user.db1=oracle
oracle.ucp.jdbc.PoolDataSource.password.db1=oracle
oracle.ucp.jdbc.PoolDataSource.maxPoolSize.db1=5

oracle.ucp.jdbc.PoolDataSource.sqlForValidateConnection.db1=SELECT 1 FROM DUAL

spring.datasource.url.db2=jdbc:oracle:thin:@//localhost:1521/DB2

logging.level.jdbc=DEBUG

oracle.ucp.jdbc.PoolDataSource.user=${datasource.username.db}
oracle.ucp.jdbc.PoolDataSource.password=${datasource.password.db}

oracle.ucp.jdbc.PoolDataSource.minPoolSize=${datasource.minPoolSize.db}
oracle.ucp.jdbc.PoolDataSource.initialPoolSize=${datasource.initialPoolSize.db}
oracle.ucp.jdbc.PoolDataSource.connectionWaitTimeout=${datasource.connectionWaitTimeout.db}

spring.datasource.type=org.springframework.jdbc.datasource.lookup.AbstractRoutingDataSource

```

在这个示例中，我们配置了两个数据源（db1和db2），每个数据源都有自己的配置文件。每个数据源都被包装在一个log4jdbc数据源中，并且有自己的抽象数据源。

最后，我们配置了一个数据源路由策略（DynamicDataSourceRoutingStrategy），该策略根据请求上下文中的特定标识符选择正确的数据源。要使用此策略，请注入抽象数据源，然后在运行时为数据源的Key设置正确的值。例如：

```java
@Autowired
private DynamicDataSource dynamicDataSource;

dynamicDataSource.setDataSourceKey("db1"); // set the data source to use for future requests

Connection conn = dynamicDataSource.getConnection();

// execute database operations using the connection
```

本示例中的DynamicDataSource实现具有自定义逻辑，根据要求的数据源key来选择要使用的数据源。这种方法允许应用程序同时连接到多个数据库，从而提高可伸缩性和性能。

要在应用程序中使用这个配置的数据源，您只需要使用`@Autowired`注解注入`DataSource`对象即可。例如：

对于Tomcat JDBC连接池以外的其他数据源，可以使用`DataSourceBuilder`创建数据源，并将其用作Spring Boot应用程序的默认数据源。例如：

```java
@Configuration
public class MyDataSourceConfig {

    public DataSource oracleUCPDataSource() {
        return DataSourceBuilder.create().build();
    }
}
```

conversation.content: springboot oracleucp log4jdbc

As an AI language model, I don't have hands-on experience with specific software like Springboot, OracleUCP or Log4jdbc. However, I can provide you with some insights on each technology.

- Springboot: is a popular Java-based framework used for building web applications and microservices. It provides a set of features and tools that help developers to create scalable and maintainable applications.

- OracleUCP (Universal Connection Pool): is a connection pooling library provided by Oracle for efficient handling of database connections. It optimizes the use of database resources by creating and managing a pool of connection objects, reducing the overhead of connection creation and destruction.

- Log4jdbc: is a lightweight logging tool that logs SQL statements and their parameters. It provides detailed information on database operations and can be used for debugging and performance tuning.

To use OracleUCP with Springboot, you can integrate the UCP library into your application's classpath and configure the data source with UCP. Then you can use the data source object to establish a connection and execute SQL queries.

To use Log4jdbc with Springboot, you need to include the log4jdbc library in your application's classpath and configure the logging properties. Then you can use the JDBC driver provided by log4jdbc, which logs all SQL statements and their parameters to the console or a file, depending on the configuration.

Overall, Springboot, OracleUCP and Log4jdbc are all useful tools for developing and optimizing Java-based web applications that require database connectivity.

   ```
    logging.level.org.springframework.jdbc.core=DEBUG
    logging.level.org.springframework.jdbc.datasource=DEBUG
    logging.level.org.springframework.transaction=TRACE
    logging.level.org.springframework.transaction.jta=TRACE
    logging.level.org.hibernate=TRACE
    logging.level.org.hibernate.SQL=TRACE
    logging.level.org.hibernate.type.descriptor.sql=TRACE
    logging.level.org.hibernate.internal=TRACE
    logging.level.org.hibernate.type.descriptor=TRACE
    logging.level.org.hibernate.engine=TRACE
    logging.level.org.hibernate.validator=TRACE
    logging.level.org.springframework.util=TRACE
    logging.level.org.springframework.context.annotation=TRACE
    logging.level.org.springframework.boot.autoconfigure=TRACE
    logging.level.org.springframework.web.servlet.DispatcherServlet=TRACE
    logging.level.org.springframework.web.filter.RequestContextFilter=TRACE
    logging.config=log4jdbc/log4jdbc-log4j2.properties
   ```
4. 创建一个@Bean来配置你的数据源，例如：

   ```
    @Bean
    public DataSource dataSource(){
        PoolDataSource dataSource = PoolDataSourceFactory.getPoolDataSource();
        dataSource.setUser("yourusername");
        dataSource.setPassword("yourpassword");
        dataSource.setURL("jdbc:oracle:thin:@//localhost:1521/orcl");
        dataSource.setConnectionFactoryClassName("oracle.jdbc.pool.OracleDataSource");
        dataSource.setInitialPoolSize(5);
        dataSource.setMaxPoolSize(20);
        dataSource.setOraclePoolDefaultUsername("yourusername");
        dataSource.setOraclePoolDefaultPassword("yourpassword");
        return dataSource;
    }
   ```

   在这个@Bean中，我们创建了一个OracleUCP数据源，并设置了相关配置。

5. 为了启用Log4jdbc，我们需要为它创建一个日志记录器。在log4j2.xml文件中添加以下内容：

   ```
    <Loggers>
        <logger name="jdbc.sqlonly" level="info">
            <AppenderRef ref="console" />
        </logger>
    </Loggers>
    <Appenders>
        <Console name="console" target="SYSTEM_OUT">
            <PatternLayout pattern="%d{ISO8601} %p - %c{1}:%L - %m%n"/>
        </Console>
    </Appenders>
   ```

   这个日志记录器将只打印SQL语句，而不包括参数。

完成以上配置后，你就可以在你的Springboot应用程序中使用OracleUCP和Log4jdbc了。你可以注入你的数据源bean并使用它来执行数据库操作。在日志文件中，你可以看到Log4jdbc打印的SQL语句。
log4jdbc springboot

要在Springboot应用程序中使用Log4jdbc，可以按照以下步骤进行配置：

1. 添加Log4jdbc的Maven依赖项，例如：

   ```
   <dependency>
       <groupId>org.bgee.log4jdbc-log4j2</groupId>
       <artifactId>log4jdbc-log4j2-jdbc4.1</artifactId>
       <version>1.17</version>
   </dependency>
   ```

2. 在application.properties或application.yml文件中添加Log4jdbc的配置。可以设置日志级别、输出格式、输出位置等。

   ```
   logging.level.jdbc=INFO
   logging.level.jdbc.sqlonly=INFO
   logging.level.jdbc.resultset=ERROR
   logging.level.jdbc.audit=OFF
   logging.pattern.console=%-5level [%d{yyyy-MM-dd HH:mm:ss.SSS}] [%t] %c{1}:%L - %msg%n
   logging.level.org.springframework.jdbc.core.JdbcTemplate=ERROR
   logging.level.org.springframework.jdbc.datasource.DataSourceUtils=ERROR
   logging.level.org.hibernate.SQL=DEBUG
   logging.level.org.hibernate.type.descriptor.sql.BasicBinder=TRACE
   logging.file.name=log4jdbc.log
   logging.file.path=target/logs/
   ```

   在这个例子中，我们设置了Log4jdbc的日志级别为INFO，让它只输出SQL语句（不包括参数），并将日志输出到一个名为log4jdbc.log的文件中。

3. 配置Log4jdbc的JDBC驱动程序。添加以下bean到你的配置文件中。

   ```
   @Bean
   public DataSource dataSource() {
       DriverManagerDataSource dataSource = new DriverManagerDataSource();
       dataSource.setDriverClassName("net.sf.log4jdbc.sql.jdbcapi.DriverSpy");
       dataSource.setUrl("jdbc:log4jdbc:mysql://localhost:3306/dbname");
       dataSource.setUsername("username");
       dataSource.setPassword("password");

       return dataSource;
   }
   ```

   在这个例子中，我们使用了Log4jdbc的驱动程序DriverSpy，并将数据源设置为jdbc:log4jdbc:mysql。当我们使用这个数据源执行JDBC操作时，Log4jdbc会记录下我们的SQL语句，将其输出到我们设置的输出位置。

4. 运行你的Springboot应用程序，并访问数据库，你会在日志文件中看到类似以下的SQL语句输出：

   ```
   SELECT * FROM table WHERE id = '123'
   ```

   这些SQL语句将会被Log4jdbc自动转义和处理。

通过以上步骤，你就可以使用Log4jdbc在你的Springboot应用程序中记录JDBC操作和SQL语句。

conversation.content: 提前成功的jdbc.sqltiming

JDBC(SQL)Timing指的是Java程序与数据库之间的SQL语句执行时间，包括SQL准备时间、SQL执行时间和结果集处理时间等。对于一个JDBC程序来说，如果SQL语句的执行时间得以提前，可以大幅提升程序的性能和响应速度。

以下是一些可能提前成功的JDBC(SQL)Timing：

1. 预编译SQL语句：提前编译SQL语句，可以减少SQL准备的时间，提升程序的性能。

2. 使用JDBC连接池：连接池可以先获取一个空闲的连接，不用每次都重新创建连接，这样可以减少连接的创建和销毁时间。

3. 批量插入数据：插入大量数据时，可以使用批量插入的方式，将多条SQL语句合并为一条，减少SQL语句执行的次数，提升程序的性能。

4. 使用PreparedStatement代替Statement：PreparedStatement可以通过预编译的方式缩短SQL执行时间，避免SQL注入攻击。

5. 数据库索引优化：通过创建索引，可以提高SQL语句的执行速度，减少扫描整个表的时间。

总之，提前成功的JDBC(SQL)Timing可以大幅提升程序的性能和响应速度，需要我们在实际开发中不断的尝试和优化。
提前日志中的jdbc.sqltiming

提前日志中的jdbc.sqltiming是指JDBC程序中执行的SQL语句的时间统计。它包括SQL语句的执行时间、准备时间和结果集处理时间等等。

在提前日志中，jdbc.sqltiming的输出格式通常如下所示：

 jdbc.sqltiming  |   1062  |  mydatabase  |  select * from mytable where id=?  |  223  |  21  |  244  |  32  |  [parameters]

其中，

- 1062表示事件的序列号；
- mydatabase表示数据库的名称；
- select * from mytable where id=?表示执行的SQL语句；
- 223表示SQL语句的执行时间；
- 21表示SQL语句的准备时间；
- 244表示结果集处理时间；
- 32表示SQL语句的执行次数；
- [parameters]表示执行SQL语句所用的参数。

在实际开发和调试中，通过分析jdbc.sqltiming，我们可以定位和解决程序中的性能问题。其中，如果SQL语句的执行时间过长，可能需要优化SQL语句或者数据库索引；如果SQL语句的准备时间过长，可能需要考虑使用PreparedStatement或者优化SQL语句的结构等等。
AOP 获取日志中的sqlonly

conversation.content: in JPA 3 and Hibernate 6, are fields marked with transient keyword persisted or not?

In both JPA 3 and Hibernate 6, fields marked with the `transient` keyword or annotated with `@Transient` are not persisted to the database. These fields are ignored by the ORM framework when mapping between the object and the database table.
